ch.unibe.iam.graph.misc
Class AttributesMap

java.lang.Object
  ch.unibe.iam.graph.misc.AttributesMap
public class AttributesMap
extends java.lang.Object

translation table between labels of complex type and an assigned integer. note: - metrics are not regarded in any way in this class - attributes are compared using a CompositeRelation, not the .equals() method !

Version:
$Revision: 1.4 $ $Data$
Author:
Christophe Irniger irniger@iam.unibe.ch

addAttribute

public int addAttribute(java.util.Map pAttr)
Deprecated. use addAttributeInteger instead

Add a new graph Attribute to the mapping. If the attribute is already stored, its assigned int-id is returned, else it is stored under a new id.

Parameters:
pAttr - the attribute to be stored
Returns:
the int-id of the attribute (-1 in case of failure to add the attribute)

addAttributeInteger

public java.lang.Integer addAttributeInteger(java.util.Map pAttr)
Add a new graph Attribute to the mapping. If the attribute is already stored, its assigned int-id is returned, else it is stored under a new id.

Parameters:
pAttr - the attribute to be stored
Returns:
the int-id of the attribute (-1 in case of failure to add the attribute)

addAttribute

public int addAttribute(int pIntAttr,
                        java.util.Map pAttr)
Add a new graph Attribute to the mapping. If the attribute is already stored, its assigned int-id is returned, else it is stored under a the given pIntAttr. if this key is already being used, nothing added.

Parameters:
pIntAttr - id of the attribute.
pAttr - the attribute to be stored
Returns:
the int-id of the attribute (-1 in case of failure to add the attribute)

containsAttribute

public boolean containsAttribute(java.util.Map pAttr)
check whether the attribute is stored in the mapping

Parameters:
pAttr - the attribute to be checked
Returns:
true if found, false otherwise

the assigned int key if found, -1 otherwise
